name: tungsten mine operation and beneficiation | tungsten concentrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22562/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of tungsten (W) concentrate production in China. An average ore grade of 0.236 %  W is assumed. Scheelite (CaWO4) and wolframite ((Fe, Mn)WO4) are the only two economically important W minerals. Literature values of the share in existing deposits are con-tradicting. While the British Geological Survey and Furberg et al (2019) report that 70 % of the global W resources are scheelite, Olafsdottir and Sverdrup (2018) and Politis et al (2017) state that 70 % of the global W resources are wolframite. For this dataset, a share of 70 % scheelite and 30 % wolframite was assumed. As depicted in the figure below, processing methods differ for scheelite and wolframite ore and the W concentrate is assumed to be produced from wolframite ore (30%) and scheelite ore (70%).;;Furberg, A., Arvidsson, R., Molander, S., 2019. Environmental life cycle assessment of cemented carbide (WC-Co) production. J. Clean. Prod. 209, 1126–1138. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2018.10.272;Olafsdottir, A.H., Sverdrup, H.U., 2018. Modelling Global Mining, Secondary Extraction, Supply, Stocks-in-Society, Recycling, Market Price and Resources, Using the WORLD6 Model; Tin. Biophys. Econ. Resour. Qual. 3. https://doi.org/10.1007/s41247-018-0041-8;Pitfield, P., Brown, T., 2011. Tungsten profile. Br. Geol. Surv.;Politis, A., Paspaliaris, I., Taxiarchou, M., 2017. MSP-REFRAM: Management of wastes from primary resource processing : identification , environmental evaluations.

The activity starts with the extraction, crushing and milling of the ore.


The activity ends with the production of tungsten concentrate with a minimum concentration of 65% WO3 (51.5 % W).
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Inputs for water are based on a publication from 1979: Yih, S.W.H., Wang, C.T., 1979. Tungsten - Sources, Metallurgy, Properties and Applications.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Chinese W concentrate production represent 82 % of the global production. The dataset is mainly based on a published inventory by Ma et al. (2017) which represents tungsten mining and tungsten carbide sites located in Jiangsu (CN) and Jiangxi Province (CN), respectively. It is unclear how many productions sites were taken into account for this study. Annual tungsten mining and tungsten carbide production capacities were reported to be  5.0 *10^5 and 1.5 _*10^3 t, respectively in 2014. Inputs and outputs were adjusted according to an average recovery rate of  75 % and an average ore grade of 0.236% that was calculated based on several literature sources reporting tungsten ore grades in China.;The average ore grade was calculated based on the following sources: ;;Han, H., Hu, Y., Sun, W., Li, X., Cao, C., Liu, R., Yue, T., Meng, X., Guo, Y., Wang, J., Gao, Z., Chen, P., Huang, W., Liu, J., Xie, J., Chen, Y., 2017. Fatty acid flotation versus BHA flotation of tungsten minerals and their performance in flotation practice. Int. J. Miner. Process. 159, 22-29. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.minpro.2016.12.006;;Lu, K.W., Gong, X.Z., Sun, B.X., Ding, Q., 2019. Life Cycle Assessment of Tungsten Production in China. Mater. Sci. Forum 944, 1137-1143. https://doi.org/10.4028/www.scientific.net/msf.944.1137;;Wu, D.D., Wen, S.M., Yang, J., Deng, J.S., Liu, J., 2013. Experimental Study on Floatation of Scheelite Ore of Jiangxi. Adv. Mater. Res. 868, 429-432. https://doi.org/10.4028/www.scientific.net/amr.868.429;;Yang, X., 2018. Beneficiation studies of tungsten ores - A review. Miner. Eng. 125, 111-119. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.mineng.2018.06.001;The average ore grade was calculated based on the following sources: ;;Han, H., Hu, Y., Sun, W., Li, X., Cao, C., Liu, R., Yue, T., Meng, X., Guo, Y., Wang, J., Gao, Z., Chen, P., Huang, W., Liu, J., Xie, J., Chen, Y., 2017. Fatty acid flotation versus BHA flotation of tungsten minerals and their performance in flotation practice. Int. J. Miner. Process. 159, 22-29. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.minpro.2016.12.006;;Lu, K.W., Gong, X.Z., Sun, B.X., Ding, Q., 2019. Life Cycle Assessment of Tungsten Production in China. Mater. Sci. Forum 944, 1137-1143. https://doi.org/10.4028/www.scientific.net/msf.944.1137;;Wu, D.D., Wen, S.M., Yang, J., Deng, J.S., Liu, J., 2013. Experimental Study on Floatation of Scheelite Ore of Jiangxi. Adv. Mater. Res. 868, 429-432. https://doi.org/10.4028/www.scientific.net/amr.868.429;;Yang, X., 2018. Beneficiation studies of tungsten ores - A review. Miner. Eng. 125, 111-119. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.mineng.2018.06.001;;Value for recovery rate was taken from ;Leal-Ayala et al. (2015);;;;Leal-Ayala, D.R., Allwood, J.M., Petavratzi, E., Brown, T.J., Gunn, G., 2015. Mapping the global flow of tungsten to identify key material efficiency and supply security opportunities. Resour. Conserv. Recycl. 103, 19-28. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.resconrec.2015.07.003
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Only under-ground mine operation, being the most common form of W mining, is considered. The system includes the concentration by gravity method and grinding and in the case of sheelite ore the concentration by sulfide flotation, scheelite flotation and roasting.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: Represents the amount of xanthate (6.37E-03 Kg) and sodium fluosilicate (1.49E-02 Kg) consumed during flotation. Amount was calculated based on input of ore (1303000 Kg), xanthate (28.45 Kg) and sodium fluosilicate (66.67 Kg) provided by Ma et al. (2017) and adjusted according to the input of ore calculated with the ore grade and recovery rate as defined in the parameter section.

exchanges.description: Represents the use of freshwater. Calculated value based on total water consumption documented by Furberg et al. (2019) assuming 70 % input of scheelite (153 L per 160 Kg of scheelte ore) and 30 % input of wolframite (46 L per 140 Kg of wolframite ore). The subdivision of total water consumption in freshwater (1 %), tap water (7 %) and pit water (92 %) was based on values from Ma et al. (2017).

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: Emissions (CS2)=D*0.002*(MW(CS2)/(MW(Xanthate) *M(Xanthate).

D: Decomposition coefficient (0.5, under alkaline conditions)

0.2 % : Proportion of xanthate decomposed hydrolytically 

MW(CS2): Molecular weight of CS2 (76 g/m)

MW(Xanthate): Molecular weight of xanthate  (144 g/mol).

M(Xanthate): Mass of xanthate consumed (6.36E-03 Kg = 30 %* chemical, organic)

exchanges.description:
Calculated value based on assumption that 73 % of the mining energy required is covered diesel and 27 % electricity (Furberg et al. 2019). Total Energy consumption was based on the input of ore (1303000 Kg) and electricity (30404.3 kWh). The input ofdiesel was adjusted according to the input of ore calculated with the ore grade and recovery rate as defined in the parameter section. conversion factor kWh to MJ: 3.6

Furberg, A., Arvidsson, R., Molander, S., 2019. Environmental life cycle assessment of cemented carbide (WC-Co) production. J. Clean. Prod. 209, 1126-1138. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2018.10.272
